Package us.daveread.edu.graphics.shape.impl

Class Image

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.daveread.edu.graphics.shape.VisibleObject
      • us.daveread.edu.graphics.shape.impl.Image
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Drawable
    public class Image
extends VisibleObject
    Displays an image. Standard image formats are supported such as PNG, GIF and JPEG. Use the scaling factor to reduce or enlarge the image from it original dimensions. The image may have a border drawn around it if the line color is set to a color. If the line color is null no border will be drawn.
    Author:
    readda

    • Constructor Detail

      • Image

        public Image​(java.lang.String imageFileName,
             java.awt.Point location,
             java.awt.Color fillColor)
        Use an image from a file. The file may be supplied as an absolute or relative path. Relative paths will be interpreted from the current working directory of the application.
        Parameters:
        imageFileName - The name of the file, including its path as required, containing the image
        location - The point for the upper left-hand corner of the image
        fillColor - The background color for the image. This is only relevant if the image contains transparent pixels

      • Image

             java.awt.Point location,
             java.awt.Color fillColor)
        Use a preloaded image.
        Parameters:

        location - The point for the upper left-hand corner of the image
        fillColor - The background color for the image. This is only relevant if the image contains transparent pixels

      • Image

        public Image​(java.lang.String imageFileName,
             java.awt.Rectangle cropArea,
             java.awt.Point location,
             java.awt.Color fillColor)
        Use an image from a file and crop it. The file may be supplied as an absolute or relative path. Relative paths will be interpreted from the current working directory of the application.
        Parameters:
        imageFileName - The name of the file, including its path as required, containing the image
        cropArea - The portion of the image to be drawn
        location - The point for the upper left-hand corner of the image
        fillColor - The background color for the image. This is only relevant if the image contains transparent pixels

      • Image

        public Image​(java.lang.String imageFileName,
             java.awt.Point location,
             double scaleFactor,
             java.awt.Color fillColor)
        Use an image from a file. The file may be supplied as an absolute or relative path. Relative paths will be interpreted from the current working directory of the application. The image will be scaled from its original dimensions based on the scale factor supplied.
        Parameters:
        imageFileName - The name of the file, including its path as required, containing the image
        location - The point for the upper left-hand corner of the image
        scaleFactor - The scaling factor to be used when drawing the image (e.g. 2 would make the image twice as large and .5 would make the image half size)
        fillColor - The background color for the image. This is only relevant if the image contains transparent pixels

      • Image

        public Image​(java.lang.String imageFileName,
             java.awt.Rectangle cropArea,
             java.awt.Point location,
             double scaleFactor,
             java.awt.Color fillColor)
        Use an image from a file. The file may be supplied as an absolute or relative path. Relative paths will be interpreted from the current working directory of the application. The image will be scaled from its original dimensions based on the scale factor supplied.
        Parameters:
        imageFileName - The name of the file, including its path as required, containing the image
        cropArea - The portion of the image to be drawn
        location - The point for the upper left-hand corner of the image
        scaleFactor - The scaling factor to be used when drawing the image (e.g. 2 would make the image twice as large and .5 would make the image half size)
        fillColor - The background color for the image. This is only relevant if the image contains transparent pixels

      • Image

        public Image​(java.lang.String imageFileName,
             java.awt.Point location,
             double scaleFactor,
             int rotationDegrees,
             java.awt.Color fillColor)
        Use an image from a file. The file may be supplied as an absolute or relative path. Relative paths will be interpreted from the current working directory of the application. The image will be scaled from its original dimensions based on the scale factor supplied and rotated based on the rotation value.
        Parameters:
        imageFileName - The name of the file, including its path as required, containing the image
        location - The point for the upper left-hand corner of the image
        scaleFactor - The scaling factor to be used when drawing the image (e.g. 2 would make the image twice as large and .5 would make the image half size)
        rotationDegrees - The number of degrees clockwise (with 0 being unrotated) that the image should be rotated when drawn. This should be a number from 0-359.
        fillColor - The background color for the image. This is only relevant if the image contains transparent pixels

      • Image

        public Image​(java.lang.String imageFileName,
             java.awt.Rectangle cropArea,
             java.awt.Point location,
             double scaleFactor,
             int rotationDegrees,
             java.awt.Color fillColor)
        Use an image from a file. The file may be supplied as an absolute or relative path. Relative paths will be interpreted from the current working directory of the application. The image will be scaled from its original dimensions based on the scale factor supplied and rotated based on the rotation value.
        Parameters:
        imageFileName - The name of the file, including its path as required, containing the image
        cropArea - The portion of the image to be drawn
        location - The point for the upper left-hand corner of the image
        scaleFactor - The scaling factor to be used when drawing the image (e.g. 2 would make the image twice as large and .5 would make the image half size)
        rotationDegrees - The number of degrees clockwise (with 0 being unrotated) that the image should be rotated when drawn. This should be a number from 0-359.
        fillColor - The background color for the image. This is only relevant if the image contains transparent pixels

      • Image

        public Image​(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img,
             java.awt.Rectangle cropArea,
             java.awt.Point location,
             double scaleFactor,
             int rotationDegrees,
             java.awt.Color fillColor)
        Use a preloaded image. The image will be scaled from its original dimensions based on the scale factor supplied and rotated based on the rotation value.
        Parameters:
        img - The image
        cropArea - The portion of the image to be drawn
        location - The point for the upper left-hand corner of the image
        scaleFactor - The scaling factor to be used when drawing the image (e.g. 2 would make the image twice as large and .5 would make the image half size)
        rotationDegrees - The number of degrees clockwise (with 0 being unrotated) that the image should be rotated when drawn. This should be a number from 0-359.
        fillColor - The background color for the image. This is only relevant if the image contains transparent pixels

      • getScaleFactor

        public double getScaleFactor()
        Get the scaling factor for the image. 1 means draw at size, 2 would magnify by two times and .5 would halve the size when rendered.
        Returns:
        The scaling factor.

      • setCropArea

        public void setCropArea​(java.awt.Rectangle cropArea)
        Set the crop area for the image. This sets the portion of the image to be drawn. It should be null if the image is to be dieplayed without cropping.
        Parameters:
        cropArea - The crop area for the displayed image

      • getCropArea

        public java.awt.Rectangle getCropArea()
        Get the crop area for the image. This sets the portion of the image to be drawn. It will be null if the image is displayed without cropping.
        Returns:
        The crop area for the displayed image

      • setScaleFactor

        public void setScaleFactor​(double scaleFactor)
        Set the scaling factor. This should be a positive number. 1 indicates no size change. Greater than 1 means to magnify and less than 1 means to shrink. If an attempt is made to set the scaling factor to 0 or less, it will default to 1.
        Parameters:
        scaleFactor - The scaling factor

      • drawBorder

        public void drawBorder​(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Description copied from class: VisibleObject
        Subclasses must implement this method to handle drawing the border. Note that the color will already have been set on the graphic context.
        Specified by:
        drawBorder in class VisibleObject
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics context for drawing

        Get the dimensions of the image based on the current scale factor and cropping area TODO account for rotation of the image
        Returns:
        The dimensions of the image

      • mouseClickDetected

        public boolean mouseClickDetected​(int x,
                                  int y)
        Description copied from class: VisibleObject
        Default implementation only matches the location pixel. Subclasses should override this to detect a click within their area.

        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the mouse click
        y - The Y coordinate of the mouse click
        Returns:
